result.execSummary:
The defendant Michael J Staniszewski was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Credit Card-Theft by Acquisition [Modifiers: Repeater], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.41(3)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: If probation is revoked or will discharge with outstanding financial obligations due, a civil judgment shall be entered for the balance due.

Maintain absolute sobriety.  Submit DNA sample.  6 month review.  AODA assessment and comply with treatment.  Any bond on hand will be applied towards costs.  Maintain full time work, treatment and or school.

Request from DOC for defendant to serve 30 days jail due to violations of supervision, with attached waiver of appearance.
Filed by Atty Amanda Riek.
Filed by Atty Amanda Riek.

Defendant Michael J Staniszewski in court with attorney Amanda K. Riek.  Jane E. Kohlwey appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Cases called: 15CM700 and 15CM599.  In 15CM599 Defendant pled no contest.  Court found guilty.  Judgment was entered.  Court withheld sentencing, placed defendant on probation for 1 year.  Conditions of probation include: $453.00 costs.  AODA assessment and comply with treatment.  Submit DNA sample.  Maintain absolute sobriety.  Maintain full time work, treatment and or school.  Any bond on hand will be applied towards costs.  6 month review.  3 days credit.  15CM700 Dismissed.
Plea/sentencing hearing on December 22, 2016 at 02:45 pm.
